repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
## Problem
Temporary files from `/tmp/` and `/private/` paths clutter `:oldfiles` list. Additionally, the documented Windows default `rA:,rB:` was never applied due to a missing platform condition.

## Solution
Drop platform-specific shada differences and default to excluding `/tmp/` and `/private/` paths.

Closes https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/21637. Part of the originally proposed filters is not included in this change and was addressed in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/18433.

comment_data.body: We need this because marks/files are excluded from shada on CI (which runs in `/tmp/cirrus-ci-build/`).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -22,6 +22,12 @@ local function _clear()
     },
     args_rm = { '-i', '--cmd' },
   }
+
+  local shada_without_path_exclusions = api.nvim_get_option_value('shada', {}) --[[@as string]]
+  shada_without_path_exclusions =
+    shada_without_path_exclusions:gsub(',r/tmp/', ''):gsub(',r/private/', '')

@@ -22,6 +22,12 @@ local function _clear()
     },
     args_rm = { '-i', '--cmd' },
   }
+
+  local shada_without_path_exclusions = api.nvim_get_option_value('shada', {}) --[[@as string]]
+  shada_without_path_exclusions =
+    shada_without_path_exclusions:gsub(',r/tmp/', ''):gsub(',r/private/', '')

comment_data.body: this is not a breaking change, should be in the news-features section
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -115,6 +115,7 @@ LUA
 OPTIONS
 
 • 'shelltemp' defaults to "false".
+• 'shada' default now excludes "/tmp/", "/private/", and "health:" paths to reduce clutter in |:oldfiles|.

comment_data.body:
Instead of calling this everywhere can you just update the `set` call here: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/ed4c549ea2436b820860c3453d348c84d441de9b/test/functional/testnvim.lua#L26-L27

The `is able to set all& after setting &shada` test in `test/functional/shada/shada_spec.lua` should still work correctly since `:set all&` will reset to the internal default.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -125,6 +125,13 @@ function M.set_session(s)
   session = s
 end
 
+--- Clear path exclusions from 'shada' that interfere with tests running in /tmp/
+function M.clear_shada_path_exclusions()

@@ -125,6 +125,13 @@ function M.set_session(s)
   session = s
 end
 
+--- Clear path exclusions from 'shada' that interfere with tests running in /tmp/
+function M.clear_shada_path_exclusions()

comment_data.body: This change makes the test to fall back to the built-in defaults and ignore the override. This is the desired behavior for this spec.
This function removes test defaults (via `args_rm` below) and sets a custom `--cmd`. We need to explicitly set `shada` without dirs again to not use built-in defaults.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -18,7 +18,7 @@ local function _clear()
       '-i',
       shada_file, -- Need shada for these tests.
       '--cmd',
-      'set noswapfile undodir=. directory=. viewdir=. backupdir=. belloff= noshowcmd noruler',
+      "set noswapfile undodir=. directory=. viewdir=. backupdir=. belloff= noshowcmd noruler shada=!,'100,<50,s10,h",

comment_regular_data.body:
1.  I agree it makes sense to drop platform-specific differences. I dropped them.
2. Assuming that https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/21818 prevents `nobuflisted` buffers from showing:
	- `rzipfile:` zipfile plugin explicitly [sets](https://github.com/pisetski/neovim/blob/b7868a0843287c03efa84a255193894be849953a/runtime/autoload/zip.vim#L238) `nobuflisted`, so these won't appear in `oldfiles`. Doesn't seem to be needed.
	- `rterm:` explicitly excluded from shada via the `bt_terminal()` check at [shada.c](https://github.com/pisetski/neovim/blob/b7868a0843287c03efa84a255193894be849953a/src/nvim/shada.c#L1995). Doesn't seem to be needed.
	- `rhealth:`  not excluded, so I've added it to the defaults.

I'm starting to think that instead of adding a `health` buffers exclusion to shada we should instead mark them as `nobuflisted`. It will keep the shada filter clean, and I doubt that anyone wants to see health buffers in their bufflist. [help](https://github.com/pisetski/neovim/blob/e5b2be66ce6fccd9b6c261d9fe3761a0a7052d56/src/nvim/help.c#L646) already does so. @justinmk, what do you think?

> starting to think that instead of adding a `health` buffers exclusion to shada we should instead mark them as `nobuflisted`

We can forget about health buffers for now. Not too important. Can drop it from the 'shada' option here.

labels.description: Nvim defaults for options, colorscheme/theme, autocmds/events, etc.
labels.name: defaults

title: feat(defaults): exclude temp directories from shada oldfiles
